title: Greek Column Orders Explained
description: Learn Greek Column Orders Explained in one minute.

hook.text: Every Greek temple uses one of three column styles. You can identify them in 10 seconds flat.

buildup.text: Doric columns are thick and plainâ€”think sturdy warrior. Ionic columns have scroll-shaped tops called volutes.

discovery.text: Corinthian columns are the fanciest, topped with carved acanthus leaves. Romans loved them for showing off.

twist.text: The Parthenon uses Doric outside and Ionic insideâ€”mixing orders was a deliberate flex of mastery.

climax.text: These three orders became the DNA of Western architecture. You'll see them on banks and courthouses today.

punchline.text: Plain, scrolled, or leafyâ€”that's the whole menu.
